names.english: dredge and clear the liver decoction
names.commonEnglish: Dredge and Clear the Liver Decoction

actions: Spreads Liver Qi and relieves Stagnation.
With Zhi Ke, for a stifling sensation in the chest, abdominal pain, poor appetite and irregular bowel movements.
Promotes the movement of Qi and reduces distention and pressure.
Strongly dries Dampness, tonifies the Spleen and clears Dampness from the Lower Jiao.
Drains Damp-Heat especially from the Lower Jiao.
With Cang Zhu, eliminates Dampness and clears Heat for Lower Jiao Damp-Heat with pain, swelling, and weakness in the lower limbs.
With Cang Zhu and Niu Xi, for Damp-Heat leg Qi.
With Zhi Mu, for Lower Jiao Damp-Heat.
With Dang Gui and Niu Xi, for a sore and weak low back and legs.
Clears Heat and drains Fire, nourishes Yin and ameliorates the drying properties of diuretics.
With Huang Bai, clears Heat and drains Fire for Yin Deficiency Fire.
Invigorates the Blood, dispels Blood Stasis, clears Heat and soothes irritability.
Tonifies, invigorates and harmonizes the Blood.
Promotes the movement of Qi, invigorates the Blood, opens the Middle Jiao, unblocks the channels and promotes water metabolism.
Clears Damp-Heat in the Lower Jiao,invigorates the Blood, expels Blood Stasis and nourishes Liver and Kidney Yin.
Clears Heat, promotes urination, cools the Blood and stops bleeding.
Strengthens the Spleen,resolves Dampness and clears Damp-Heat.
With Cang Zhu, Huang Bai and Niu Xi, for Damp-Heat pouring downward leading to atrophy and weakness of the lower extremities.
Drains Damp-Heat from the Liver and Gallbladder channels.
Spread Liver Qi
Clear Dampness
Purge Heat from Liver and Gallbladder
Invigorates the Blood

symptoms: Pain and fullness in the chest, ribs and flanks
Maybe pain in the right hypochondrium
manifestations.pulse: Wiry and rapid or Slippery and rapid
